node.title: Darwin shooter apologises in court, explains why he pleaded guilty
node.alt: A sketch of Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann in court.
node.description: Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann, who has pleaded guilty to murder and manslaughter, says there are two key reasons why he changed his plea from not guilty to guilty mid-trial.
node.content:
["Murderer Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann has today told Supreme Court Justice John Burns there were two key reasons why he changed his plea from not guilty to guilty in the seventh week of his nine-week trial.", "Speaking from the dock, flanked by security guards, Hoffmann stood up and told the judge negotiations between himself, his defence team and Crown prosecutors led to yesterday's move.", "\"The two factors that I considered were that prosecution would accept that I am genuinely sorry and remorseful for my actions,\" Hoffmann told Justice Burns.", "At this point in Hoffmann's speech, crown prosecutor Lloyd Babb SC objected.", "Justice Burns told Hoffmann that as he was not sworn in or giving evidence, there was \"very little weight\" he could give the comments.", "", "
Benjamin Hoffmann was arrested on the night of June 4, 2019, after\u00a0the shootings.(Supplied)
", "Hoffmann appeared to acknowledge Justice Burns, but chose to keep speaking.", "\"That prosecution would accept that I am genuinely sorry and remorseful for my actions,\" he repeated.", "\"That the courts would consider giving me a non-parole period, these are the two factors I considered when pleading guilty.\"", "Hoffmann yesterday changed his plea to guilty\u00a0to the murders of Hassan Baydoun, Michael Sisois, and Robert Courtney during a shooting spree on June 4, 2019.", "He also pleaded guilty to the downgraded charge of manslaughter in relation to the death of Nigel Hellings as well as four lesser charges, including recklessly endangering life and making a threat to kill.", "Under Northern Territory legislation, those found guilty of committing more than one murder face a non-parole period of 25 years.", "Justice Burns has not set a date to sentence Hoffmann and submissions from both sides are underway.", "
Psychiatric experts disagree on state of mind
", "Forensic psychiatrist David Greenberg, who began giving evidence Tuesday afternoon, today told the court he was of the option that Hoffmann \"understood\" what he was doing at the time of the shooting spree.", "\"Is he delusional? Is he out of touch with reality? In my opinion, not,\" Professor Greenberg told the court.", "", "
Jon Tippett QC has been representing Benjamin Hoffmann through his\u00a0trial.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "However, consultant forensic psychiatrist Kerri Eagle disagreed with Professor Greenberg's assessment and said she believed Hoffmann was psychotic during his shooting spree.", "\"I believe he had persecutory delusions at the time of the offending, yes,\" Dr Eagle said.", "Dr Eagle said examples of Hoffmann's \"fixed and false\" delusions included concerns he'd been poisoned and that someone had been hurting his lover.", "Defence barrister Jon Tippett QC pressed Dr Eagle about previous witness testimonies, which described Hoffmann as \"calm and organised\" and able to hold conversations during the rampage.", "Dr Eagle said a delusion could \"fluctuate in intensity\" and some people could \"function relatively well\" despite experiencing persecutory delusions."]
